page.title: 03WEST HULL TRAFFIC CENSUS
page.content: THERE ARE THREE MAIN ROUTES INTO W. HULL. THE AVERAGE WAS TAKEN OF THREE CENSUS'S IN MID_AFTERNOON ANLABY RD. HAD THE HIGHEST AVERAGE OF CARS OF THE THREE ROADS WITH 274 PER HOUR IN EACH DIRECTION. THIS WAS UNEXPECTED,ALTHOUGH IT IS A GOOD ROUTE TO MANY OUT OF TOWN COMMUNITIES. 80% WERE LOCALLY REGISTERED CARS. BOOTHFERRY RD. THE MIDDLE OF THE THREE, LINKS DIRECTLY WITH THE M62 AND HAD THE HEAVIEST FLOW OF COMMERCIAL VEHICLES WITH 233 IN AND 219 OUT PER HOUR. ONLY 31% OF INWARD WAS LOCAL, A THIRD WAS FROM THE SOUTH. A MORNING SURVEY WOULD PROBABLY HAVE A HIGH % OF LOCAL TRAFFIC GOING OUT OF HULL. HESSLE RD. TO THE SOUTH HAD 98 LORRIES PER HOUR OUT AND 66 IN; WITH A LOW 10% LOCALLY REGISTERED. 113 CARS PER HOUR WITH ONLY 20% LOCAL.
